tdPsDJs4JmIyknhI0d-jkw.text: I came here with my parents. I had tamales and got to try their tacos. The tacos were the best I've had in Charlotte -- fresh, flavorful and authentic. The tamales were good, but I was expecting them to be head and shoulders above every other tamale I've had, and they weren't.  Of the three kinds I tried, the best was the cheese with quesadillas. I was not able to try the sweet tamales.

xRtoBZKB5WVM_HFXeRcxwg.text: Awesome tamales and tacos! The restaurant has a good little selection of both plus some other menu items that I've yet to try. I've gone three times since they've opened me have not been disappointed! The staff is very friendly, and the restaurant is quite tidy. Definitely looking forward to going back many more times!

eAtkq7p1DQTBPBRyJGIuZg.text: A real find. Cash only. The pastor tacos had amazing flavor. On my short list now of favorite nearby places.

CRhXN75eKZnheHjr7I6EGQ.text: This place is ridiculously good.  Have been three times now and it seems like it gets better every time.  Asada tacos are my favorite, and the tamales are unreal.  I've never had them like this place's before.    And the people that own it are super nice.  It's a neighborhood gem.

Dd9fqVBnaeU3sOCHjwTd5g.text: Great homemade authentic Mexican food.  Remember to push the door open. This was our only challenge. Service with a smile and a happy tummy.

WEqB_KaPidofZ2JwnsCDGg.text: Excellent authentic food cooked to order. Great friendly service. Price is good and portions are appropriate. Will come again.

GAvU-1AW2ae4WidQj1eTbA.text: Nice authentic tacos at a reasonable price.  I had one barbacoa taco and one carnitas taco.  Both were good, but the carnitas was better.

-xfN9BDSnwqce0OMcjvCCA.text: By far the best Mexican restaurant in Charlotte! Very clean, super nice staff, and food is UNBELIEVABLE!!! Can't wait to go back!

tOUBs0BS6hLJ4Tz2LNzpBA.text: Superb and Fantastic Food.  Very Delicious and Tasty.  Definitely try the fruit juices - from the fruit not processed.  Reasonably Priced.  They accept the credit cards through Four Square.  Friendly Environment.  Fast and Efficient Service.  Family Owned and Operated.  We have short listed this restaurant on our Go To List.  Highly Recommend to All and don't let the outside fool you.

qzEAGxPFH8suQlFOPqf_cw.text: Awesome food. Very nice people. Three salsa roja tamales with rice and beans made for a lot of tasty takeout. Can't wait to go back.

NoYL17FPdrbDuWTwMU_wKQ.text: I truly support small family own business. My husband and I eat at a lot of "hole one the wall" establishments. I did not mind that the little boy working in the front was very inexperienced, or half of my orders, they did not have.  I gave it a three because the tacos were good but the salsas was just too salty. Salsa verde is the more spicy one.  The tamales had little fillings and the masa is too thick. This makes it "dry" to eat, but when dipped with the salsas, too salty.   Overall it was not worth $35.00.  I will try it one more time to make sure it was not a mistakes with the salty salsas. Plus I would like to try the three dishes they didn't have today.

5y1ljab3A2HRF2vD8erHKQ.text: This place is wonderful. The people are incredibly nice. The food is delicious. As of yesterday, they now take cards/Apple Pay. We have been going for the pozole since they opened. We've also had tacos, tamales, the chicken mole, the quail, and the new tostadas that they just added to their menu. Everything is good! They always have aguas frescas to offer. We have had mango, watermelon, cantaloupe, and pineapple thus far. One time they had horchata to offer as well. If you haven't seen this place, it's across the street from the Food Lion on The Plaza. It's a small hole-in-the-wall restaurant that's well worth a visit. Be sure to ask for some hot sauce. Mmmmm!!

photos.caption: Photo of Tamales La Pasadita - Charlotte, NC, United States

eIIVEUJDj1CjonGM5vsECQ.text: WAY OVER RATED! The tamales were just okay. Meat inside dry and I'm more a fan of a delicate more flaky tamale masa mix. This masa was dense and cut like clay. The meat inside had traditional flavor but could be cooked more tenderly. The rice basic and beans the Same. Charlotte has a long way to go in the food department.

VNGOQNuf0xEtEk8_HbQr3Q.text: Holy (insert all the cuss words here). This place is incredible.  Tiny little joint off Plaza, serving us amazing $8 specials of three tamales with rice and beans.  You can get a selection if you want. Also enjoyed two tacos $3 ea and two glass bottle cokes ($2.50), which were the best tacos - beating out my personal fav La Unica. And glass bottle coke is delish, so basically everything about this $20 meal for two is perfect. Try all the sauces and I promise you will roll out full and happy.

k_eIvraTKI2gwE9mbXgOgw.text: Solid gold!  I had the pozole and a lengua and barbacoa taco. Everything was much, much better than Ezra.

JR9FQOIHX7S7gLksvFuA1w.text: Well, it's the holiday season so I was craving some tamales. Pass this place on my way home so I stopped in. So glad I did as I just finished my two tamales and they were damn good! Going back soon. What a gem.

photos.caption: Photo of Tamales La Pasadita - Charlotte, NC, United States

7cZB7lNfTY4Q9YglwotVYA.text: Don't be intimidated by the outside appearance or all-Spanish menu -- this is the place you should go the next time you're looking for authentic Mexican food.  Everyone inside is super nice and the food comes out quick. And yes, they speak English which is great because tengo que practicar mi espanol.  The menu is the perfect size and everything is well-priced and well-portioned -- I got three tacos and two tamales (I'm a fat kid) for about $11. The food tasted amazing and I can't wait to try more!  Please go here so it can stay open and prosper!

0OnWpmh4W4PqjJQ4U1ifKw.text: Carne Asada and Barbacoa tacos were the best seasoned meat I've had in CLT.   Fresh made fruit juices, the watermelon water was so good.  And very nice family run business, with homemade food, very authentic at great prices.  $1.75 tamales and $2.75 tacos they will be taking credit cards by next week. Cash only at this time.

photos.caption: Photo of Tamales La Pasadita - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pork tamale and Barbacoa taco... Amazingly good!

IkKhq27NICBh8FM2pQWvQw.text: This place looks suspect from the outside but the food inside is awesome!   Walked in and got greated with a smile and a loud "Hola!". I tried a pastor taco, a pork tamale, and a chicken quesadilla. All great!  I've never had a Mexican mother/grandmother...until now. She may not know it yet but it's happening. I felt like I was in her kitchen as I sat at the bar and she whipped up the food to order.  Thanks mamacita!

X9ztTaDU-4s07KtbwK3Ftg.text: Great little tamale & taco joint. Definitely not fancy, and that's good, because it would detract from the character and the experience. Just a tiny shop with a few booths and a few counter stools, a tv showing Mexican programming, and a glass fridge with Mexican Coke and Pepsi in tall glass bottles. The service is super friendly and pretty quick. Prices are very reasonable. The pork tamales were the best I've had in Charlotte. Barbacoa tacos were also excellent. Can't wait to go back and try more kinds of tamales.

OBytQ-ErBSDmLK9iNig0jw.text: Tamales La Pasadita is one of my favorite places to get food in Charlotte. It's on a strip of The Plaza with like 10 tire stores, a vape shop, hypnotist, etc., and the exterior couldn't be more modest.  The people who work there, from the lovely abuela to the adorable little girl, are super-nice.  The prices are crazy cheap. But of course, you're there for food, and we've never been disappointed.  The pork, chicken, barbacoa, cheese, and other tamales are all delicious and made to order. They also have tacos, mole, real fruit juices. I know the lines will grow once more people discover it -- at this point there's never a wait -- but I wish nothing but success to the fine people who run this place.

64VKTV4zRPvgXhnnoXHUQA.text: As advertised, 5 star hole-in-the-wall authentic taco shop. To be fair, it's a very clean establishment and not so much of a hole in the wall. We had taco al pastor and barbacoa, both spot on and served with homemade verde and rojo spicy sauce as well as crema fresca (sour cream). Washed it down with some delicious fresh pineapple juice. We will be back very soon! FYI, it says cash only everywhere but it seems like the have ability to accept CC payments via the square on their iPad, but bring cash just in case. Enjoy!

kUrkri0-GyOzt0XW3wR-tw.text: Best Mexican food in charlotte. I love the agua fresca can't get enough of it so fresh good drink for hot days. They also have the best tacos in charlotte because they are packed with meat and have great condiments with it.

rEFhn5P66QQHRkSdUlEBmg.text: Sooooooo GOOD!!! Everything was super flavorful, best place I have tried so far in Charlotte. The people that work there are super nice as well

yljQuTKoIetUC4F7vSD7-w.text: Amazing! Great tamales, also love the chicken tacos. Service is awesome and the inside is clean and inviting. They also have delicious homemade salsas and the most delicious pineapple and mango juices.

qYl3fIveC9dQE1i3WODAyQ.text: The chicken & steak tacos and tamales were seasoned well and really good paired with the 2 different salsas. I service was fast & the owner seemed nice. I took the food to go & enjoyed the meal at home. I would go back again for another order!

photos.caption: Photo of Tamales La Pasadita - Charlotte, NC, United States. 1 chicken tamale, 1 steak taco, &amp; 1 chicken taco.

geT-GE2www03Kl6hR0faGg.text: Had some really great tamales (the tamales made from fresh corn as opposed to pre-made masa). They were delicious. We also had a bunch of tacos. All were delicious. My favorite was the lengua! Mom and daughter duo run the place. We will be back.

in_NDd0scHHTaXu3sUgmyg.text: The pozole is awesome!!! The rest of the menu is pretty stellar too!! The staff is super friendly and the place has a nice family owned setting. Go try it out!!

2TZBS8AIFFr5dmOV2VdgXQ.text: Best damn tacos in Charlotte. I am a lover of all tacos and have not found a better place with authentic tacos around.

vdfPaGj9jMTHrwZnu_7PeA.text: Tamales and tacos are amazing! Very friendly staff. Had chicken, pork, and pineapple tamales. Chicken mole and Barbacoa tacos were on point as well!

rFKZEjie0_7mZpFoSxQPnQ.text: Super authentic Mexican food cooked. I think it's the best in Charlotte and I've tried it all on both sides of the border. Tamales made fresh daily, along with menudo, pazole, tacos, mole, etc. Don't the let the outside appearance discourage you, it's an oasis of deliciousness. I've gotten carry out and dined in and it's both been great.   They do take credit cards *most* of the time, but I've been a few times when their internet/square reader is down. Come with cash just in case!

WNVureyj2PkFs5QTwI_Fpg.text: This past Saturday I was out with some friends who wanted to check out Tamales La Pasadita. Having never heard of it, no problem. I love trying new places. It is a hidden gem on The Plaza. Although it appears very small from the outside it does goes further back with several booths and single seats down a countertop. Now, don't expect anything fancy, just a good old school restaurant.  The menu is on the wall above you and as I checked it out they offer an extensive list of items, Tacos, Tostados, Tamales (of course) and several more.  They also have aquas fresca in several different flavors. Having never been I decided to stick to some basics, just to get my bearings down. I ordered two chicken tacos, no cilantro, a carnitas tamale and rice and beans.  Everything is cooked to order and can be tailored as you wish, no cilantro, no problem.   The food arrived piping hot from the kitchen and was so fresh. The tortillas were heated/fried to perfection and the tacos had a great amount of chicken and onions. The tamale was amazing. And, the rice and beans..definitely order the rice. It was cooked perfect and just the right side to go with my meal.  It was hard to not finish them, but I was so full. Tamalas La Pasadita is a definite Taco Joint I will hit again.    A True family owned restaurant with great food and service...

photos.caption: Photo of Tamales La Pasadita - Charlotte, NC, United States. Rice &amp; Beans with a tamale!
Photo of Tamales La Pasadita - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken Tacos
Photo of Tamales La Pasadita - Charlotte, NC, United States. Menu

HLWZ_n4YJ7ZKM0IMvQjFDw.text: Was a very nice experience. Good food, nice people. Think Mexico street food, but CLEAN! They have a 93 health score.  If you like tamales you better get here fast.

photos.caption: Photo of Tamales La Pasadita - Charlotte, NC, United States

ZvnexcWnblduKomThHg1FA.text: You gotta love a great "hole-in-wall" style restaurant! When we were in the mood for some tacos after a day of drinking, we knew we had to try this place with so many Five-Star ratings! And boy did it ever live up to the other reviews! They offer the usual suspects from tamales, tostados to tacos and have a great fresh variety of types from barbacoa, chicken, tounge, and pork! Everything was incredibly fresh and tasted incredibly authentic! But beware their fruit flavored water is addictive and their jalapeno packs quite a punch  Definitely tons of flavor here and worth the trip!

photos.caption: Photo of Tamales La Pasadita - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Tamales La Pasadita - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Tamales La Pasadita - Charlotte, NC, United States

Vyr2QUoqjxamShXfgclpQg.text: As a recent Los Angeles ex-pat, I have a deep burning longing for really good authentic Mexican food. There have been some glimmers of hope and some bitter disappointments along the way (I'm talking to you! Cinco de Mayo! Really?! Liquid queso and bacon bits do not belong on good Mexican food!! SHAME!!)  Hermanos y hermanas, I am here to sing the praises of Tamales de Pasadita. Gone are the urges for an authentic barbacoa or al pastor street taco. No longer will you yearn for your Christmas tamale. Fear not the neighborhood or appearance of the rough this diamond is nestled in. A warm smile and a courteous hello await you just inside, as does the best food this reviewer has had in quite a while.  Much as gracias a mis amigos por la comida fantastica.

sJjcPHsQHnkK0whpBqMpCQ.text: Some of the best tacos in town!  This restaurant is a hidden gem on The Plaza.  Love supporting this local family.

bNVIZ3tIpo1nWRChRU063A.text: i mean wow!!   the pozoles is to die for.   my son & i just happen to try this place out cuz i was close proximity to the music venue we're going to.  wat a find!   tamales is definitely authenticly good.  definitely worth another visit for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of Tamales La Pasadita - Charlotte, NC, United States

3XSmFvM3B2SKr6TabhWOLg.text: Great food and good service! Try them out for sure. I'll definitely be going back as soon as possible.

uRLs2SIwv0Pp9QyyzzR8mw.text: Delicious food, nice people, good prices, and fast service.  It doesn't get any better.  Do not let the outside appearance fool you, the inside is spotless.  Also, try the agua fresca. It's delicious.

N1Js2tLmvE2NWcdR5oSc8w.text: If you like tamales, this is your stop. Green sauce with pork are my favorite Tamales . The vegetarian in a banana leave is great also but I wish the could make the same with chicken and red sauce...  recommended 100%

2vHYJXQXMoKSaIlN9mSfCw.text: Please understand the gravity of this review, as what I am about to say bears much weight.  The 3 tacos that I had for lunch today (steak, barbacoa and al pastor) were THE best tacos I have ever eaten.  Tacos like this could bring about peace and understanding to feuding nations across the world.  I will most certainly be back, this time in sweatpants.  Well done, folks.  Well done indeed.

tfcWfi0_fkZWMUCKlwDwag.text: I'm not going to lie, the only thing I have had is tacos. Every time I go in I swear I will try something else but I just end up getting tacos...lots of tacos. I have tried all of them in different combinations and they are always a home run. The very first time I rolled up to the building I was stoked. It is bare bones with the focus on the food. Sure you can go to a Mexican chain restaurant for the hip decor and the mediocre food. I prefer the functional over fashionable and Tamales La Pasadita definitely puts the focus on the food. Exceptionally friendly staff, clean restaurant and very well executed food is the reason why I ate here everyday (14 days) that I was in Charlotte.

PIePa9vcuIuvUsMTrPH38A.text: Great tamales.  dont forget to get the side sauces.  i always want to branch out and try their other food, but i cant NOT order the tamales when i go.  they have corn, queso, pork, and chicken.  the other food looks good when other people eat it.  i usually get take out, the tamales are also good reheated at home.    dont expect much in the way of atmosphere, it actually does remind me of the small roadside restaurants ive visited while in central america, makes it feel more authentic to me i guess.  They are currently expanding into the next door space.  my one recommendation is that they switch to paper/plastic menus instead of the not-so-easily-updated marquee menu board they have, it just looks ugly with all the things marked out/taped over/written over.    if you like off the beaten path, small family run joints, this is the spot for you.  or if you just like good tamales, get it to go.

IcKxo2Pz3SocNIsmTrz1xg.text: Great Tamales! I am new to Charlotte and have been searching for good Tamales for the holidays. Well, I found them! Hands down the best I've had since moving from the West coast!! Great service, nice conversation and I even got some tasty salsa added to the order, for free!

SgRiPwdmUafB9uHENSp1cg.text: Driving down the plaza when the sign popped out at me. I'm always up for a "real" tamale. Empty inside but the reviews had me motivated to try. I got a jalepeno cheese and chicken tamales. Good price and delicious.

tbD9M9q9qnB7atBRPK_ahw.text: Second time trying this place--first time was not good and sad to report that my second time was even worse. I'm a big tamale fan, but haven't found a great place for them since I moved from Chicago, so I was willing to give this place a second chance. And, for the record, I actually love the look and decor of Tamales La Pasadita.  My issue is with its food and service.   When I tried to place my takeout order today, the server spent most of his time watching a soap opera playing behind me and got testy when I modified my order.  When we got home to eat the food, the tamales were rubbery and not tasty at all.  Worst of all, in all of our meat orders, (carnitas and pollo), there was bone, which is always unpleasant to come upon.  Just generally terrible food. I loathe being the bearer of bad news, as there is nothing I would want more than to find a delicious hole in the wall spot.  But this place is not it.

tXywWj8-CzTdC2O2_ug-YA.text: I'd give no stars for this place if I could based on my experience but decided to be generous with two. Why? For one, the sauces were good (that's it) and two, everyone is entitled to a bad day. But this must have been a horribly, awfully bad day. We get there at 1:30 in the afternoon (4 adults, 1 kid) place our order and sit down. We all ordered chicken as our protein which, since there are only 4-5 proteins on their menu shouldn't be a problem. 10 minutes later the lady comes up and says they don't have chicken so we exchange it for carnitas (disappointed but no big deal). 5 minutes later she comes back, there's no pork either so they just made our whole order with steak (um...whattt?). We get no choice, the food comes. My tamale I ordered was DRYYYYYYY. I didn't eat it. The steak tacos, even though not at all what we ordered weren't bad but nothing special. Then when we went up to pay (and we did the math) what should have been a 40 dollar bill ran up to 60 dollars. We all added it up and it didn't make sense at all. We were too frustrated to argue and just paid and left. Won't be back.

IpyMwKLvH8-V33fHYHBOZw.text: so glad we came here for lunch! they had tamale specials (3 tamales w rice and beans for $8) and my brother got Pollo asado. the tamales were so good and the Pollo asado was really tender and yummy. it's a hole in the wall, and I've found those to usually be the best :) wasn't disappointed!

photos.caption: Photo of Tamales La Pasadita - Charlotte, NC, United States. came with 2 salsas (green=spicy, red=less spicy, smoky) and sour cream; Pollo asado came with corn tortillas
Photo of Tamales La Pasadita - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pollo asado
Photo of Tamales La Pasadita - Charlotte, NC, United States. tamale special, came with a plate with shredded lettuce, limes, tomato and radish

AJQmFDyuA14qZGa-d_mESA.text: My absolute favorite place to eat tamales (besides grandma's house) lol. Love the staff and love the food! The tamales are wonderful. And the tacos are huge and so delicious! I just tried the sopes today and those are also super delicious! I love this place and I would recommend it to anyone looking for traditional, home made Mexican food.

photos.caption: Photo of Tamales La Pasadita - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sope and tamales de pollo! So good!

xrBbltORkq5D2VoA34tyug.text: Def off the beaten path. Place is super clean which is always nice to see. Food was just meh. Tamales were super spicy, more spicy than I am used too. The one was unbearable to eat it was so spicy. Went back a second time just to try the tacos and carne asada which was better but not anything that would make me come back a 3rd time.  Somewhat pricey as well as if you don't order a special, everything is a la carte which can add up pretty quick. Shouldn't be that expensive for mexican food.

rYRjYfQY22lHlDUUDQ7mYA.text: pollo asado was amazing!  a little surprised the chicken was cooked and served with skin on, one taste and i am still thinking about that flavor!  very friendly experience, parking was just fine, dining area was clean and tidy.    now about the bathrooms...  the door frame for the toilet room is appropriately sized for pre-pubescent children and most abuelas.  i got a nice chuckle as i ducked into the room to break the seal.  somehow i quickly forgot the doorframe was small and proceeded to smash my head into said frame after flushing.  huge wow factor, i briefly wondered if rick moranis shrunk the building while i was in the toilet room...then my wits returned.  all that to say duck twice in the toilet room.

IdtBRO9H_nyJaRe07632LA.text: I'm waiting to check in to my air bnb and seriously hungry after hitting the breweries last night. The building is so unassuming you may miss it but don't! I ordered the lunch special, 3 tamales with rice and beans.  I love tamales. I order them everywhere I go and these were amazing. I ordered the tamales de pollo en salsa rojo and smothered them in the hot sauce the lady behind the counter gave me. The tamales are soft and the meat is juicy. The rice and beans are flavorful and a great change of pace from the spice of the tamales. If I lived here, I'd be a regular.   Definitely hit this place up if you're in the area. It's a hidden spot not to be missed.

photos.caption: Photo of Tamales La Pasadita - Charlotte, NC, United States. Tamales de pollo en salsa rojo, rice, and beans.

34KBwQlLksaMuS3nqZ0Hfw.text: The owner Braulio is attentive and passionate about the restaurant. These tamales are definitely authentic and delicious. All three are different- left to right cheese with a slice of Chile, red sauce with shredded chicken (a little spicy), lastly green salsa with pulled pork. $2 per tamal. The carne asada taco is so fresh- add some of their homemade green salsa and sour cream. $2.75.  Their Aguas frescas (fresh juice) are made daily they are out of this world. $2.50 and you can get a refill.   This restaurant is a hidden gem with out a doubt. Stop by, you won't regret it!

photos.caption: Photo of Tamales La Pasadita - Charlotte, NC, United States. Different angle.
Photo of Tamales La Pasadita - Charlotte, NC, United States. Watermelon and pineapple Agua frescas. Authentic carne asada taco.
Photo of Tamales La Pasadita - Charlotte, NC, United States. 3 types left to right cheese with a slice of Chile, red sauce with shredded chicken (a little spicy), green salsa with pulled pork.

158z50Yirnroo0mQFVYD-g.text: This is a great, hole in the wall, family friendly place. I feel like I'm eating tamales from a family recipe passed down for generations.  Three tamales with rice and beans for $8 is the daily special.

rLi3elwC37x1ANUBS9SDlA.text: Wow! This place truly took me by surprise! During Love Week the bestie and I decided to take a lunch break between events. So we headed to Tamales la Pasadita. I must say I was a little skeptical but at the same time I'm ALWAYS down to try a place once lol, and if I love it... of course I'm reviewing it and then I'll go back hahaha.  Well that has happened for this place! Walking into the restaurant that has the BEST TAMALES in Charlotte I absolutely LOVED how brightly colored the sea foam green. It gave the restaurant so much light and made it feel very refreshing when you walked in. The entire restaurant was SPICK AND SPANE CLEAN! And I take note of everything and this place was spotless! According to the owner his wife likes things to be clean lol.   I LOVE IT!   The bathrooms were small but understandable due to the size of the restaurant. And the hand wash station was outside of the restroom. So that's good, this way you don't have to worry about touching a door knob after washing your hands. SMART!  The entire menu is in Spanish, so if you don't know Spanish, can't read Spanish, or at least know what the basic words mean like {Pollo = Chicken}... You may want to download a translator app. Thankfully I know a little Spanish plus I had my bestie with me lol. I ordered what I could then she went through and made sure I ordered it correctly.   Food Although we went for Tamales I also wanted tacos and I do glad I ordered both! The tacos were sooo delicious ! But the tamales were out of this world! Hot, fresh and filling! Everything was made to order and didn't take long to make. Oh and they had Augas Frescas my FAVORITE!!!! This is the first place in Charlotte that I've located it so if I only go back for a full cup of this, I'll be a happy girl. But I'll be back for it all. For all the food we had, our bill was $14.00.  Tamales: $2.00 ea Augas: $2.75 ea Tacos: $2.00 ea   You can't beat that!

photos.caption: Photo of Tamales La Pasadita - Charlotte, NC, United States. Volunteering
Photo of Tamales La Pasadita - Charlotte, NC, United States. Walking in
Photo of Tamales La Pasadita - Charlotte, NC, United States. Tamales and Augas

iwXSVLVdiNHKEzwZItPifQ.text: You know what they say. Tamale is another day.  One of the best places to eat in all of Charlotte with some of the most delicious Mole you can imagine.   I would know. I have a Mole on the inside.  Also, absolutely wonderful service and good prices and probably my favourite meal in the whole city that I've had so far - and I've had quite a few good ones. Like The Cure, I come to "Charlotte Sometimes", and when I do, I come here.  Really... One of the best restaurants I've ever eaten at in North Carolina. The prices aren't bad and the food is spectacular. The service is as good as the food. The mole is second-to-none and absolutely dreamy, perfect and delicious. The tamales are the excellent kind wrapped in banana leaves, and are amazing as well.  It's a very unheralded little place, so make sure you stop by when you're in North Carolina to try some of the best Mole I've had anywhere in the country.  Eat here quickly. Before the world ends as predicted by Dennis Quaid. Oh wait, that was that movie, The Day After Tamale.  Prices aren't dirt cheap, but then neither is your Dad. Oh wait, he is.  And don't try to kill your Tamale. Because Tamale Never Dies.

photos.caption: Photo of Tamales La Pasadita - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pasa dita on the left hand side
Photo of Tamales La Pasadita - Charlotte, NC, United States. Check out my cutely positioned mole
Photo of Tamales La Pasadita - Charlotte, NC, United States. I&#39;ll eat the rest tamale

S-1r9Igq7dWnk0E6vmXedg.text: I've been trying to find the best tacos in Charlotte and I am still on the search. Got there around 6:30pm. It's pretty hidden. I've been driving down plaza road all the time and never noticed it. It was very dead and quiet, but clean. Parking was a little bit sketchy, but I had no other choice. I ordered one of each of every variety of taco that they had and wanted to try their famous tamales. I ordered their red chicken tamales. Unfortunately the tamales was a let down. The tamales itself and the chicken was dry. Maybe because it wasn't fresh and they probably had to heat it up, but one compliment is that the masa had a very good flavor to it which I enjoyed.   The tacos on the other hand were quite delicious. The meat portion was very generous and the flavor of each one were very delightful. The hot sauces and watered-down sour cream were a nice addition too. For me I like to smother my tacos with sauce, but for this place, you want to be careful because their least spicy sauce is already spicy for me (I'm not a spicy person, but for the average person, it is spicy). I truly enjoyed my taco experience. If it wasn't for the tacos, I would have given this place a 3 and a half star review. One thing I did wish they would have done would be to give me a little more slices of radish to compliment the tacos.  Pros: good meat portion for tacos, flavorful meat, clean inside  Cons: expensive tacos ($2.75 each), dry tamales, sketchy parking   Conclusion: not the best tacos in town

photos.caption: Photo of Tamales La Pasadita - Charlotte, NC, United States. All the variety of tacos that they offered
Photo of Tamales La Pasadita - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Tamales La Pasadita - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken tamales

6qmFG0G7c7EZaeOMW54wNA.text: I like this place. It is clean. It is simple. It is straightforward.  Order at the counter. They bring it to you.  Be prepared for a very authentic experience.  This is not your basic Tex Mex restaurant in Charlotte. I had chicken with mole sauce.  It can came with yellow rice and black beans and tortillas.  I think the tortillas were handmade.  I also had a tamale with raisins. So, the mole sauce was not quite as sweet as I like. It was somewhat bitter for my taste, but was still good.  The rice and beans were terrific. The raisin tamale was chewy and not my favorite.  They are known for tamales, so I had to get one.  I was disappointed that they didn't have iced tea.  Remember, it is authentic, so they had fresh fruit drinks: watermelon, cucumber, and papaya. I gave in to the papaya juice. So sweet, but so good.  If you are into clean holes in the walls, authentic Mexican food, and a simple dining experience, go here.  Don't expect any service, besides bringing your food to the table.   They don't ask you how everything is. They don't provide drink refills.  They don't ask you if you need a box for take out of leftovers.   I wish they would have done those things.  If you go here and want to practice your Spanish, this is a great place to pull out your Spanish words!   I am a fan!

photos.caption: Photo of Tamales La Pasadita - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Tamales La Pasadita - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Tamales La Pasadita - Charlotte, NC, United States

TdCvOV91BktHr_bt_giL-w.text: The tamales here are perfect! I tried the chicken & pineapple tamales and they were perfect!  However my friends had the pork tacos and it was a bit too dry. I would definitely be back for the tamales!

_TSPd42MfjGmLNSK8hoagw.text: This is one of the best hidden places. I lived down the street for 2 years without going in and I regret it. I get the mole, which is awesome. Tamales are good too.

rcB7Agg9Y1K80C_KqrZCig.text: If you care more about good food than ambiance then you will love this place. No frills, just a small room with a counter and some booths. Perfect, I don't want to pay $10 to sit in a fancy room, I come for the food.   Ordered three tamales the pollo, puerco, and Coco.   All three of them were amazing! The coconut one would especially be good on nights when you're craving a little something sweet. They have a choice of salsa Verde and salsa roja with crema as well. At $2.00 a pop these are definitely worth the price and a great budget lunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Tamales La Pasadita - Charlotte, NC, United States. Tamale de Coco, pollo, y puerco.
Photo of Tamales La Pasadita - Charlotte, NC, United States

jswBsGD9c2xCBjLX981HSQ.text: Good food. They could be charging much more for this kind of cooking. Boricua stamp of approval.

photos.caption: Photo of Tamales La Pasadita - Charlotte, NC, United States

npWt38sC-hU0sTkLVJgRHw.text: It's my favorite place to go for traditional Mexican food, hands down the best place for tamales.

photos.caption: Photo of Tamales La Pasadita - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken tamales and barbacoa tacos, sooooo goooodddd

PBhDmqP8AKxcY54cl04jDg.text: I've always wished I had a Mexican grandma. A little old lady who would speak to me in Spanish, make me tamales and pinch my cheeks. Tamales La Pasadita might just fill that void. When we arrived for dinner around 8pm on a Saturday night, we were the only ones in the small restaurant. We sat at the counter and chatted with the friendly young man taking our order. He speaks beautiful English by the way, in case anyone was worried about a language barrier.   We ordered a little bit of everything... Tacos (even the lengua!), tamales, rice & beans, a tostada and aguas frescas. Everything was delicious, especially when we added the red hot sauce and sour cream from the squeeze bottles. The real stars were the tamales though! I tasted the chicken, queso & jalapeno (my favorite) and pineapple. The aguas frescas are the perfect way to cool off your mouth from too much hot sauce. I loved the watermelon, Ted enjoyed his pineapple. I swear, I think I could live on tamales and aguas frescas alone...  Happy to have discovered another authentic spot in Charlotte!

photos.caption: Photo of Tamales La Pasadita - Charlotte, NC, United States. View from the stools at the counter.
Photo of Tamales La Pasadita - Charlotte, NC, United States. Tacos!

i-I9nGkMba4a7NxqDfUTAA.text: Si, si, si! Delicioso!  It's worth a stop at the ATM. Cash only.   This is a little hole-in-the-wall tamale and street taco restaurant. The seating is limited to a handful of booths and maybe a half dozen seating at the counter. How cozy!  Hubs & I packed up the newborn and were on a mission for authentic, fresh tamales. Score! When the plate arrived at our table, we instantly were pleased. The aroma took us back to some of our best vacations. The flavor was savory and the portions were generous.  We had a 3-tamale platter special and 2 street tacos for less than $15! And we were completely full and satisfied. What?!!  The food is made to order. Employees are very courteous.   Wish it were closer to me and I'd become a regular. Guess it's a good excuse to get out of my Charlotte bubble. Go, enjoy, take cash!

npF6jM5jOD6gsLtDSd41xA.text: Great food. At a great price. And value. Unlike its name sake the tamales are not little. Worth checking out

vQPBSB5LVnLZ_2eWufnXFw.text: Best tacos I've had in a very long time. Friendly staff and extremely clean on the inside. I have found my new taco spot.

6GeCVl7-RJqMBZ03MUzp0g.text: Really good authentic food at very reasonable prices. They're very nice and provide quick service. All of the sofas are bottles real came sugar sodas which is a fun find. The portions a large which is great.

photos.caption: Photo of Tamales La Pasadita - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sit down area
Photo of Tamales La Pasadita - Charlotte, NC, United States. Partial menu
Photo of Tamales La Pasadita - Charlotte, NC, United States

0gT2KJu4mPJXkQsQmpM3Fg.text: I love a good hole in the wall place and this was PERFECT! The tacos & tamales were authentic and savory. A must try! Only 10 mins from uptown and not too busy on a Wednesday which is perfect for lunch!

4-5bO1-wMIS7WsieAcHavA.text: I was so excited to find a good Tamale place in Charlotte, but very disappointed to find that Tamales La Pasadita fell short of even my most modest expectations. It smells like my great grandmas house and has no music playing... the painful silence allowed me to hear the microwave running in the back constantly. The two women working acted like we were an inconvenience even being there. The tamales were rubbery and steaming from being microwaved, the pozole was also scalding and burnt tasting. The tacos were decent but nothing you can't get elsewhere. Overall very disappointed.
